books.title: Oil!
books.author: Upton Sinclair
books.summary: A wealthy oil tycoon’s son grapples with his father’s unethical business practices as he forms alliances with oilfield workers and socialists in Southern California.

books.title: Bulldog Drummond
books.author: H. C. McNeile
books.summary: A demobilized officer places a newspaper advert for adventure, and its response leads him to discover a conspiracy.

books.title: Narrative of the Life of Frederick Douglass
books.author: Frederick Douglass
books.summary: Frederick Douglass describes his youth as a slave in Maryland and his desire to be a free man.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: The Secret of the Caves
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: Four boys vacation at nearby caves only to be swept up in a mystery.

books.title: The Cords of Vanity
books.author: James Branch Cabell
books.summary: An arrogant young author makes his way through a series of love affairs, avoiding every situation that may cause unpleasantness.

books.title: Tartuffe
books.author: Molière
books.summary: A father announces his daughter will marry Tartuffe, a sanctimonious fraud and hypocrite.

books.title: Phantastes
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: A young man awakes in Fairy Land, where he takes part in a series of strange adventures.

books.title: The Three Hostages
books.author: John Buchan
books.summary: A former man-of-adventure is coaxed out of comfortable retirement and into danger as he aids in the rescue of three hostages.

books.title: The Case of Charles Dexter Ward
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: A young scholar delves into his family past and finds more than he bargained for.

books.title: My Disillusionment in Russia
books.author: Emma Goldman
books.summary: Emma Goldman recounts her experiences living in the early Soviet Union.

books.title: Poirot Investigates
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A calculating Belgian detective and his wide-eyed companion investigate and solve a series of mysteries.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.

books.title: Discourses
books.author: Epictetus
books.summary: Epictetus instructs his students how to live the life of a Stoic.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Frances Ellen Watkins Harper
books.summary: A collection of poems by Frances Ellen Watkins Harper.

books.title: Point Counter Point
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: Several connected stories are interwoven to create a satirical look at English society.

books.title: The Skylark of Space
books.author: E. E. Smith
books.summary: A scientist accidentally creates a way to travel to other star systems, while a rival scientist tries to steal all of his work.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Anthony Trollope
books.summary: A collection of Anthony Trollope’s short stories, ordered by date of first publication.

books.title: The Pilgrim’s Progress
books.author: John Bunyan
books.summary: An allegorical story of a pilgrim in search of redemption, followed later by his wife and children, passing through great trials before reaching the Celestial City.

books.title: The Innocents Abroad
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain travels abroad, offering witty observations on the places and cultures he encounters and commentary on the habits and foibles of his fellow travelers.
